wp4.samples.models¶

Classes

BarCodedItem(*args, **kwargs) Base meta class for many Sample classes, that extends VersionControlMixin with a barcode field
BloodSample(*args, **kwargs) Sample class type for Blood samples.
DeviationMixin(*args, **kwargs) In place of Deviation records on a worksheet, we have a way of tracking them per sample.
Event(*args, **kwargs) A Sample Event is a timepoint and process where a specific type of biological sample was extracted from a person.
Organ(*args, **kwargs) The focus of the trial, specifically a Kidney.
OrganPerson(*args, **kwargs) Base attributes for a person involved in this case as a donor or recipient
PerfusateSample(*args, **kwargs) Sample class type for Perfusate samples.
TissueSample(*args, **kwargs) Sample class type for Perfusate samples.
UrineSample(*args, **kwargs) Sample class type for Urine samples.
VersionControlMixin(*args, **kwargs) Internal common attributes to aide system auditing of records
Worksheet(*args, **kwargs) Record of each Worksheet that links specific samples taken with a specific OrganPerson

Exceptions

ValidationError(message[, code, params]) An error while validating data.
class wp4.samples.models.BarCodedItem(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Base meta class for many Sample classes, that extends VersionControlMixin with a barcode field

Parameters:
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • version (django.db.models.PositiveIntegerField) – “version” - Internal tracking version number
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Not presently implemented or used
  • barcode (django.db.models.CharField) – “BC01 barcode number”

class Child(Model):

class Child(Model):

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Worksheet.event_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class wp4.samples.models.Event(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A Sample Event is a timepoint and process where a specific type of biological sample was extracted from a person. This even can validate whether enough biological samples were taken (e.g. a blood sample results in two separate containers; whereas a perfusate sample has only one), and acts as the link between a Worksheet and the various Sample types

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • version (django.db.models.PositiveIntegerField) – “version” - Internal tracking version number
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Not presently implemented or used
  • worksheet_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “worksheet”
  • type (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “EV01 sample type”
  • name (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “EV03 sample process name”
  • taken_at (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “EV02 date and time taken”

worksheet¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

clean()[source]¶

If type is...

  • BLOOD - check for two different types of BloodSample
  • URINE - check for one type of UrineSample
  • PERFUSATE - check for one type of PerfusateSample
  • TISSUE - check for two different types of TissueSample

... and that a suitable Event name was chosen, and that taken_at value is not in the future.

Returns:None
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception Event.MultipleObjectsReturned¶

class wp4.samples.models.DeviationMixin(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

In place of Deviation records on a worksheet, we have a way of tracking them per sample. Also holds the meta question of whether this specific sample was actually taken or not.

Parameters:
  • collected (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “DM01 sample collected?”
  • notes (django.db.models.TextField) – “DM02 notes” - Deviation record
class Meta[source]¶
abstract = False¶
class wp4.samples.models.BloodSample(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sample class type for Blood samples.

Also contains a helper (repeated, but direct) link to the OrganPerson this sample was from (mainly to aide reverse sample look ups from OrganPerson)

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by” - User account for the person logged in when this record was made/updated
  • version (django.db.models.PositiveIntegerField) – “version” - Internal tracking version number
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Not presently implemented or used
  • barcode (django.db.models.CharField) – “BC01 barcode number”
  • collected (django.db.models.NullBooleanField) – “DM01 sample collected?”
  • notes (django.db.models.TextField) – “DM02 notes” - Deviation record
  • event_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “event” - Link to an event of type Blood
  • blood_type (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “BS02 blood sample type”
  • person_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “BS03 sample from”
  • centrifuged_at (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “BS01 centrifuged at”

clean()[source]¶

If sample is marked as collected, confirm taken_at date is present, otherwise that deviation notes have been recorded.

Ensure that centrifuged_at datetime is not in the future, and that it occured after taken_at datetime

Returns:None
